metadata.title: Brandwatch Measure Module User Flows
metadata.description: Comprehensive collection of user workflows for dashboard creation, widget configuration, data analysis, and reporting within Brandwatch Measure

flows.flow_description: Step-by-step process to create a new Measure dashboard using one of the 16 available templates

steps.description: Access the main Measure interface and select dashboard creation option
steps.user_input: Click on 'Create Dashboard' or similar button

steps.description: Choose from 16 available templates including Facebook Overview, Instagram Overview, LinkedIn Overview, etc.

decision_point.question: Which template best fits your reporting needs?

steps.description: Select which social media channels to include in the dashboard
steps.user_input: Check/uncheck desired channels from connected accounts

steps.description: Define the time period for data analysis
steps.user_input: Select start and end dates or choose preset ranges

steps.description: Preview dashboard configuration and finalize creation
steps.user_input: Click 'Create Dashboard' or 'Save'

expected_outcomes: New dashboard created with selected template
Data populated from chosen channels and date range
Dashboard available in user's Measure workspace
Widgets automatically configured based on template
error_handling: Insufficient channel data: Select different date range or channels
Template loading failure: Refresh and retry
Permission errors: Contact administrator

flows.flow_description: Process to create and configure custom widgets with specific metrics and visualizations
prerequisites: Existing dashboard or access to create one
Understanding of channel vs content metrics

steps.description: Navigate to widget creation from dashboard view
steps.user_input: Click 'Add Widget' or '+' button on dashboard

steps.description: Choose from 11 available widget types

decision_point.question: What type of visualization do you need?

steps.description: Select up to 16 metrics for Key Metrics widget or appropriate metrics for other widget types
For applicable metrics, select total vs average calculation
steps.user_input: Select 'Total' or 'Average' radio button

steps.description: Add content or label performance filters to refine data
steps.user_input: Configure filter criteria as needed

steps.description: Provide descriptive title and save widget to dashboard
steps.user_input: Enter widget title and click 'Save' or 'Add to Dashboard'

expected_outcomes: Data displayed according to selected metrics and filters
Real-time data updates according to refresh schedules
error_handling: Metric selection errors: Verify platform compatibility
Data loading issues: Check channel connections
Filter conflicts: Review filter logic and criteria
source_documents: Measure/Creating, Editing, and Deleting Measure Widgets/Creating Measure Widgets.pdf

flows.flow_description: Process to connect and configure data sources from various social media platforms
prerequisites: Admin access to social media accounts

steps.description: Navigate to channel or data source management section
steps.user_input: Access account settings or channel management

steps.description: Choose from supported platforms

decision_point.question: Which platform do you want to connect?

steps.description: Complete OAuth or API key authentication process
steps.user_input: Provide credentials and authorize access

steps.description: Set up historical data backfill and refresh schedules

Facebook.refresh_schedule: First refresh 15 minutes after post publication, then varying intervals for 14 days

Instagram.historical_data: 200 days for channel metrics, varies for audience metrics

LinkedIn.historical_data: 365 days except for fans and net new fans

steps.description: Test data flow and confirm metrics are populating
steps.user_input: Review sample data and confirm accuracy

expected_outcomes: Historical data backfilled according to platform rules
Platform metrics available for dashboard and widget creation
error_handling: Authentication failures: Re-authorize or check credentials
API limit exceeded: Wait for reset or contact support
Data sync issues: Verify account permissions and try reconnection
source_documents: Measure/Creating, Editing, and Deleting Measure Widgets/Editing and Deleting Measure Widgets.pdf

flows.flow_description: Process to share dashboards with team members and set appropriate access levels
prerequisites: Knowledge of team member permissions needed
Understanding of viewer vs editor access levels

steps.description: Navigate to sharing settings from dashboard view
steps.user_input: Click 'Share' button or sharing icon on dashboard

steps.description: Choose between individual users or team-wide sharing
Define what recipients can do with the dashboard

decision_point.question: What level of access should users have?

steps.description: Review any channels that shared users cannot access

steps.description: Complete sharing process and notify recipients

flows.flow_description: Process to export dashboard data in CSV format for external analysis
prerequisites: Understanding of export format (ZIP with separate CSV per widget)

steps.description: Navigate to export functionality from dashboard view
steps.user_input: Click 'Export' button or menu option

steps.description: Choose CSV export option
steps.user_input: Select 'CSV' from export format options

steps.description: Customize what data to include in export

decision_point.question: Do you want to customize the exported metrics?
options: Add additional metrics not currently displayed

steps.description: Start the data export and wait for processing
steps.user_input: Click 'Export' or 'Download'

steps.description: Download the generated ZIP file containing CSV files
steps.user_input: Click download link when export is complete

expected_outcomes: ZIP file downloaded containing separate CSV for each widget
All dashboard data exported in structured format
Data suitable for external analysis tools
error_handling: Export timeout: Try smaller date range or fewer widgets
File download issues: Check browser settings and retry
Data formatting problems: Verify widget configurations
source_documents: Measure/Getting Started/Data Refresh Rates in Measure.pdf

steps.description: Ensure dashboard is displaying desired date range and data

flows.flow_description: Process to configure advanced filtering options in Content and Label Performance widgets

options: Post type filters (text, image, video, link)

steps.description: Set specific values and conditions for the selected filter
steps.user_input: Enter threshold values, select criteria, or choose labels

steps.description: Review how filters affect the displayed data

expected_outcomes: Widget displays filtered content according to criteria
Data focuses on specified content types or performance levels
Filter settings saved with widget configuration

Filter conflicts: Review multiple filter interactions

platform_specific_options.Facebook: Add fan engagement and reach analysis widgets

metric_selection.question: Which type of metrics do you need?
options: Channel metrics (performance during selected date range)
Content metrics (lifetime performance of individual posts)
metric_selection.guidance: Channel metrics measure overall account performance during a specific period, while content metrics measure individual post performance over their lifetime.

calculation_method.question: How should metrics be calculated?
calculation_method.guidance: Use totals for cumulative metrics like total engagements, use averages for rate-based metrics or when comparing periods of different lengths.

platform_coverage.question: Which platforms should be included?
platform_coverage.guidance: Consider your analysis goals: single platform for deep dives, multi-platform for comparative analysis, all platforms for comprehensive overview.

Facebook.data_refresh: Content metrics refresh 15 minutes after publication, then at varying intervals for 14 days, completion at 28 days after last engagement
Facebook.ad_account_impact: More metrics available with connected ad account, including detailed paid performance data
Facebook.unique_features: Distinction between viral and non-viral reach, extensive video metrics

Instagram.data_refresh: Channel metrics refresh once every 24 hours at 7AM UTC
Instagram.historical_data: 200 days backfill for most metrics, limited audience metrics backfill
Instagram.content_types: Separate tracking for Posts, Stories, Reels, and IGTV
Instagram.unique_features: Story mentions and replies tracking, detailed Reels analytics

LinkedIn.data_refresh: Channel metrics refresh once every 24 hours at 7AM UTC
LinkedIn.historical_data: 365 days backfill except for fans and net new fans
LinkedIn.organic_vs_paid: Most metrics are organic-only, specific metrics show combined totals

data_connection_issues: Check API rate limits and quotas
Reconnect accounts if authentication has expired
Contact support for persistent connection problems
insufficient_data: Adjust date range to include more data
Verify channels have activity in selected period
Check if platform has minimum data requirements
Consider using different metrics with available data
permission_errors: Verify user role and permissions within Brandwatch
Check social media account admin access
Review sharing permissions for collaborative features
performance_issues: Reduce date range for large data sets
Limit number of metrics in complex widgets
Consider breaking large dashboards into smaller focused ones
